meanings.definition: To push against something with steady force
meanings.sent1: She presses the door to open it.
meanings.sent2: He presses the button to call the elevator.
meanings.sent3: The cat presses its paws against the window to get a better view.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches press against the fence in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The weightlifter presses the barbell above his head with determination.

meanings.definition: A machine used to apply pressure
meanings.sent1: The factory uses presses to shape metal parts.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic fixed the car using a hydraulic press.
meanings.sent3: The bakery's press helps make perfectly round cookies.
meanings.sent4: The bookbinder's press creates beautifully bound books.
meanings.sent5: The olive press extracts oil from olives efficiently.

meanings.definition: A group of journalists or news organizations
meanings.sent1: The presses reported on the breaking news story.
meanings.sent2: The presses gathered to discuss the latest headlines.
meanings.sent3: The presses competed to get the exclusive scoop.
meanings.sent4: The presses worked together to uncover the truth.
meanings.sent5: The presses published the article simultaneously.

meanings.sent1: She presses her dress before the party.
meanings.sent2: He presses his shirt to make it look neat.
meanings.sent3: The robot presses the clothes with precision.
meanings.sent4: The steam iron presses out the wrinkles effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The laundry service presses and folds the garments professionally.

meanings.definition: To urge or compel someone to do something
meanings.sent1: He presses his friend to join him on the adventure.
meanings.sent2: She presses her colleague to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The teacher presses the students to excel in their studies.
meanings.sent4: The coach presses the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent5: The parent presses the child to practice the piano daily.
